intro: Viguiera oligantha, commonly known as Mexican blanket flower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branching. Viguiera oligantha is valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and bees.
